page.title: 18Transport
page.content: Nowadays most families in the area own a motor vehicle as most of us travel for shopping, work, medical services, recreation and leisure. 80% of the children in Waterhouses Middle School travel to school by bus, 10.5% travel by school taxi or car, 8% walk and just a few come on bicyles. After the decline of public transport in recent years, we now have a "staged" transport system, whereby the public can use any of the school buses. The Education Authority gets a diesel subsidy from the Government which means that rural transport has become viable. The only remaining railway line now transports stone from the quarries. A disused branch line links the quarries to Waterhouses. Along the southern border of our area, the track bed of the old tramway from the quarries to Froghall is a reminder of the past.
